keyword: how many calories in two slices of bacon
title: How Many Calories in Two Slices of Bacon?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in two slices of bacon, plus detailed nutrition facts on fat, protein, sodium, and variations for healthier tweaks.
h1: How Many Calories in Two Slices of Bacon?
assumptions: Standard pork bacon, pan-fried until crisp, medium thickness slices (~15g each), excess fat drained.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, slice thickness, cooking method, and fat trimming. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two slices of cooked bacon provide about 86 kcal and 6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use turkey bacon instead of pork

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of bacon?
faqs.a: About 43 kcal per slice of cooked pork bacon.

faqs.q: Is bacon high in fat or sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, two slices have ~6.6 g fat and 384 mg sodium.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Frying adds more fat than baking or microwaving; baking can reduce by ~10 kcal per slice.

faqs.q: What's the protein in two slices of bacon?

faqs.a: Turkey or chicken bacon has fewer calories (~23 kcal per slice) and less fat.
